page.description: These are the event hooks for the AudioPlayer and AudioRecordAndPlayer controls.

description.p: Fires if the user aborts a new recording that would have overwritten an existing audio recording.
This event is available with the [AudioRecorderAndPlayer] control.
Fires before the control is loaded.

The *[ui:onBeforeOverwriteRecording]* event fires when there is an existing recording and the user clicks the record button. If there is an existing recording, the recording will get overwritten. This event will allow you to prompt the user if they really want to overwrite the existing recording. If the event returns false, the new recording is aborted.
This event is available with the [AudioRecorderAndPlayer] control.
This event can be used to create a custom progress display while an audio is playing back.
Fires when the playback is complete.
The onError event fires when an audio file does not load.
Fires when the audio file is loaded.
Fires when the playback is paused.
Fires when recording is paused. This event is available with the [AudioRecorderAndPlayer] control.
Fires when recording resumes. This event is available with the [AudioRecorderAndPlayer] control.
Fires when the recording is saved. This event is available with the [AudioRecorderAndPlayer] control.
Fires when recording starts. This event is available with the [AudioRecorderAndPlayer] control.
